Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Essentially \Es*sen"tial*ly\, adv. In an essential manner or degree; in an indispensable degree; really; as, essentially different. [1913 Webster]

essentially adv : at bottom or by one's (or its) very nature; "He is basically dishonest"; "the argument was essentially a technical one"; "for all his bluster he is in essence a shy person" [syn: {basically}, {fundamentally}, {in essence}, {au fond}]
